subject: Re: [junit] How to test void methods
msgSnippet: ... Here s what I do: public void testDeposit() { ... assertNotNull(account); account.deposit(100); assertEquals( Expected 100 here , 100, account.getBalance()
messageBody:
On Mon, 19 Feb 2001, balakrishnan sengodan wrote:

> Hello everyone,
> Does any one know how to test a methos which returns
> void. For example
> public void deposit(int amount) {
> balance += amount;
> }

Here's what I do:

public void testDeposit() {
...
assertNotNull(account);
account.deposit(100);
assertEquals("Expected 100 here", 100, account.getBalance() );
try {
account.deposit(0);
fail("Expected zero-deposit exception here");
} catch ( AmountException ae ) {
}
try {
account.deposit(-10);
fail("Expected negative-deposit exception here");
} catch ( AmountException ae ) {
}

}

--
Joi Ellis Software Engineer
Aravox Technologies joi@..., gyles19@...
